facts:

  • GS: Retail equities net buy @ record-breaking pace
  • 6.5tn debt due in Jun'25 , JPow hawkish resistance to Trump spells crisis: 30Y bond flirted 5%

title: Week of Math Education Revisit
events-prof:
Math Education
  • Joined a 800-strong wts group of math experts and students.
  • Spent ~45 hours over the week revamping my 2022 M2 reminder deck (MS Paint, 28 slides) to 2025 ver (LaTeX beamer, 39 slides). Received 13k views on ig (exp. 10k).
  • Coordinated with a taskforce of another EMath student and two teachers on distributing/ upscaling resources (ongoing).

Personal

  • Did Mensa on Saturday. Comfortable entry if not careless.
  • Locked in HKPFS, other scholarships and collaborations.
  • Devised auto text-to-html converter app

"

  • Able to preserve/ enhance my edge in math edu hobby
  • Recognition on previous work's impact from student feedbacks/ teachers' praises of my free mock quality

gratitude:
"
  • Delayed sleep phase disorder (DSPD) is common in high-cognition, screen-heavy lifestyles, but our circadian rhythms are plastic (changeable easily).
  • If allowed to follow own schedules, e.g. 6am to 3pm sleep, sleep quality and peak work efficiency could be preserved.
"

up_next:
"

Interaction btwn sleep deprivation and social func

  • Autism is linked to genetic mutations that affect melatonin regulation and circadian rhythm
  • Sleep disruption brings hyperactivity and easier distraction than those who sleep well
  • sleepiness predicts less social motivation (Axelsson et al., 2020), less social activity (Holding et al., 2020), and worsened social skills (induced autism?)
"
